me.jwotoole9141.prodsline.user

Class Employee

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.jwotoole9141.prodsline.user.Employee

  • public class Employee
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an employee for the production audit trail.
    Author:
    Jared O'Toole

    • Constructor Detail

      • Employee

        public Employee(int id,
                java.lang.String firstLastName,
                java.lang.String password,
                boolean useDefaults)
        Creates a representation of an employee with their credentials.
        Parameters:
        id - the employee's identity number (auto-incremented by the database)
        firstLastName - the employee's first and last name, separated by a space (letters only)
        password - the employee's initial password (one upper, lower, and special character)
        useDefaults - if true, replace invalid arguments with defaults

        public void setId(int id)
        Sets the employee's id.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String firstLastName)
        Sets the employee's first & last name, username, and email address.

        A valid name contains a first and a last name (letters only) separated by a space.

        Parameters:
        firstLastName - the name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - an invalid name was given

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Sets the employee's password.

        A valid password contains at least one lowercase character, one uppercase character, and one special character (that is not a letter or a number).

        Parameters:
        password - the password
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - an invalid password was given

      • isValidName

        private boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        Tests if the given name is valid or not.

        A valid name contains a first and a last name (letters only) separated by a space.

        Parameters:
        name - the employee's name
        Returns:
        true if the name is valid, else false

      • isValidPassword

        private boolean isValidPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Tests if the given password is valid or not.

        A valid password contains at least one lowercase character, one uppercase character, and one special character (that is not a letter or a number).

        Parameters:
        password - the password to test
        Returns:
        true if the password is valid, else false

      • setUsername

        private void setUsername(java.lang.String firstName,
                         java.lang.String lastName)
        Sets the username of this employee based on their name.

        The username is formed from the first letter of the first name concatenated with the full last name, all in lowercase.

        Parameters:
        firstName - the employee's first name
        lastName - the employee's surname

      • setEmail

        private void setEmail(java.lang.String firstName,
                      java.lang.String lastName)
        Sets the email address of this employee based on their name.

        The email if formed from the first name joined with the last name by a period, all in lowercase.

        Parameters:
        firstName - the employee's first name
        lastName - the employee's surname

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a string representation of this employee's credentials.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a multiline string
